posts.post_content:
"So, Mr. Cadet, how do you feel about being outclassed by a dog?"
  
"Well, that's the Hound of Konda you're talking about. I can't compete with a trained war dog."
  
"What about being beat out by a midget? A man without a face?"
  
"Hey, the Daru are trained fighters. And those Kithkin are fierce."
  
"A trinket merchant? A girl who plays a harp? A goblin startler? A POET?"
  
"Um, well, I'm sure the trinkets and the harp are....magical. And you know....goblins can be scary..."
  
"And you got beaten out by a bird."
  
"Oh for the love of..."
posts.html:

"Hey, the Daru are trained fighters. And those Kithkin are fierce."
"A trinket merchant? A girl who plays a harp? A goblin startler? A POET?"
"Um, well, I'm sure the trinkets and the harp are....magical. And you know....goblins can be scary..."
"And you got beaten out by a bird."
"Oh for the love of..."

Posted By: Shadowcaster3975 (1/5/2013 2:57:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think we can fix this. He's "eager" right? So let's just slap on First Strike and then you get this nice little cycle of one drops in each color that have an evergreen ability.
  
   
W: Eager Cadet - 1/1 - First Strike
  
G: [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) - 1/1 - Tap for F
  
R: [Raging Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Goblin) - 1/1 - Haste
  
B: [Plague Beatle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Beatle) - 1/1 - Swampwalk \*
  
U: [Fugitive Wizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fugitive Wizard) - 1/1 - Shroud\*\*
  
   
   
\*Yes, Swampwalk so it's not really evergreen but whenever there's a cycle with basic abilities black always gets stuck with swampwalk. In today's game, I'd have it have deathtouch which, in my opinion, fits the name "plague beatle" better than swampwalk.
  
   
\*\*Yes, Fugitive Wizard doesn't have an ability, but its bifrucated name fits the cycle, as does its cost and 1/1 -ness. And giving him Shroud fits his flavor.
posts.html:
I think we can fix this. He's "eager" right? So let's just slap on First Strike and then you get this nice little cycle of one drops in each color that have an evergreen ability.

W: Eager Cadet - 1/1 - First Strike
G: Llanowar Elves - 1/1 - Tap for F
R: Raging Goblin - 1/1 - Haste
B: Plague Beatle - 1/1 - Swampwalk *
U: Fugitive Wizard - 1/1 - Shroud**


*Yes, Swampwalk so it's not really evergreen but whenever there's a cycle with basic abilities black always gets stuck with swampwalk. In today's game, I'd have it have deathtouch which, in my opinion, fits the name "plague beatle" better than swampwalk.

**Yes, Fugitive Wizard doesn't have an ability, but its bifrucated name fits the cycle, as does its cost and 1/1 -ness. And giving him Shroud fits his flavor.

posts.post_content:
Strictly worse than the following white one drops in the same format:  
  
[Elite Vanguard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elite Vanguard) 2/1  
[Midnight Duelist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Midnight Duelist) 1/2 AND pro vampires  
[Hada Freeblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hada Freeblade) Pumped by other Allies.  
[Champion of the Parish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of the Parish) Pumped by any other human.  
[Doomed Traveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomed Traveler) Replaces itself with an evasive attacker.  
[Gideon's Lawkeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon's Lawkeeper) Taps target creature.  
[Loyal Sentry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loyal Sentry) Trades with whatever it blocks.  
[Ardent Recruit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ardent Recruit) 3/3 with Metalcraft.  
[Infantry Veteran](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infantry Veteran) Temp pump on an attacking creature.  
[Honor Guard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor Guard) Can increase its toughness for W.  
  
Keep in mind, these are strictly better in EVERY sense, keeping in mind the human and soldier subtypes. If you leave room for different subtypes in the W drop position, and this list easily triples in size.
